reviews.text: I chose the San Francesco B & B based on the reviews from this website. My husband and I were so pleased.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Siena
The Hidden Gem of Sienna
reviews.text: Our room was large, immaculate, quiet, and had a marvelous view. (I don't think all the rooms do - luck of the draw.) The room and bath were modern but charming and located in a XV century building. Mossimo, the manager of the B & B is most helpful. Located on one end of the old town near the San Francesco Basilica and a university, the B & B is away from the crowds of tourists, but still near an excellent restaurant and some shops and a grocery.

reviews.title: The best in Siena!
reviews.text: Although the B & B is at the other end of the historic center from the bus station, we found it to be an easy walk. Siena is a great place to stay and San Francesco B & B made it even more pleasant.

This was my first time staying in a B&B and my expectations were somewhat high.I wasn't let down.The building transported you back to Medevial times with modern touches. I stayed in the Leonardo room with a friend and the room was beautiful,airy and clean.
reviews.title: Best B&B In Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ONE NIGHT WAS ENOUGH !!. We had to call Massimo many times for directions.It was difficult to find the (Very expensive ) parking , and then it got worse!, It was not easy to find access up to the town , we we did it was up several escalators , no fun in the heat with suitcases.After finally arriving at the top we still could not find the B&B , we must have made a dozen phone calls.
reviews.title: ONE night was enough !!

likes.disliked: — No air con , noise out side, difficult to find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in times are very awkward , and you have to vacate the room early in the morning for a cleaner !! . I cannot under stand the rave reviews about the beakfast , very dissappointing , only good thing was the coffee. We had the window open , no air con , and it was baking , but the noise from scooters below was awful , could not sleep , so we left the next morning .
reviews.title: Great place but tricky check-in & summer noise

reviews.text: Massimo is a very nice guy , but not impressed with the accommodation , sorry.
reviews.title: Value for money and then some!

likes.disliked: — er... if i have to- i would have liked to have had ham at breakfast, but that is about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely place as noted in the other reviews, so I won't repeat the plusses. Only two minuses: (1) when we arrived at 1 PM and phoned Massimo from a pay phone, he didn't answer his cell phone despite several tries. So we had to trudge back to the parking lot (about 10 minutes each way) and stow our luggage in the car, and go back and get it later when we reached him. Very important to phone him BEFORE you arrive -- since we had no cell phone we didn't do this. If you arrive in the morning most likely he'll be there so should not be a problem. Also the web site indicates the latest time you can check in - I would take this seriously as staff time is limited. (2) Some traffic noise - it wasn't a problem since we were there in the winter and had the windows closed, but in the summer it would be bothersome.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great value

reviews.text: What an excellent little B&B for the price paid (80 euros a night).
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in Siena
